lead_paragraph: There was virtually nothing but rainforest for miles, and then the government agents spotted it: a makeshift shelter, the fire still smoldering. There were two sets of footprints, two machetes and two spots for hammocks.
headline: Brazil Found the Last Survivors of an Amazon Tribe. Now What?

abstract: Amazon said in August that it intended to appeal to the national labor board if it did not prevail at the regional level, but it did not say Monday whether it would follow through.
lead_paragraph: A regional office of the National Labor Relations Board on Monday ordered a new union election at an Amazon warehouse in Alabama, upholding a union challenge to a vote that the company won decisively.
headline: Union Vote at Amazon Warehouse in Alabama Is Overturned by Regional Labor Office

abstract: Colombia’s president announced that the children had been found alive after the May 1 crash. But now it’s unclear if rescuers had actually made contact with them.
lead_paragraph: For more than two weeks, search-and-rescue teams in Colombia have scoured the Amazon rainforest for four children who were aboard a plane that crashed on May 1. The bodies of the three adults on board were found in the wreckage, but there was no sign of the children.
headline: A Plane Crashed in the Amazon. Did Four Children Survive?

abstract: For too long, the fate of the rainforest has rested on the shoulders of environmental and human rights activists.
lead_paragraph: What I’d heard of a little Brazilian town on the eastern edge of the Amazon had prepared me for the worst. Criminality plagues many areas of Brazil, and the government’s presence remains feeble in the interior of the country. But even by that measure, the pace of homicides in the region is staggering. “It’s a risky town for a reporter,” said Danicley de Aguiar, a Greenpeace activist.
headline: The Defenders of the Amazon Never Wanted to Be Martyrs

abstract: Amazon might not be the best shopping site, but using it can feel like magic.
lead_paragraph: This is a preview of the On Tech With Shira Ovide newsletter, which is now reserved for Times subscribers. Sign up to get it in your inbox three times a week.
headline: How Amazon Won Shopping

abstract: With its investment of up to $4 billion, Amazon is seeking a bigger footprint in A.I. development, one already established by rivals like Microsoft and Google.
lead_paragraph: Amazon said on Monday that it would invest up to $4 billion in the artificial intelligence start-up Anthropic, as the world’s biggest technology companies race to benefit from A.I. breakthroughs that could reshape parts of their businesses — and the economy as a whole.
headline: Amazon Takes a Big Stake in the A.I. Start-Up Anthropic

abstract: His ambitious, long-running project in Brazil explored the impact of deforestation on animals and plants — and how to deal with it.
lead_paragraph: Thomas Lovejoy, a prominent biologist for major conservation groups who spent decades on an expansive, ongoing project in Brazil to preserve the Amazon rain forest, died on Saturday at his home in McLean, Va. He was 80.
headline: Thomas Lovejoy, Wide-Ranging Ecologist and Amazon Rescuer, Dies at 80

abstract: Brazil is seeking to share the cost and burden of protecting the rainforest with the private sector. But it has found few firms willing to help.
lead_paragraph: This article was produced in partnership with the Pulitzer Center’s Rainforest Investigations Network.
headline: Brazil’s Bid to Outsource Amazon Conservation Finds Few Takers

abstract: Despite heavy lobbying by the company, workers at the facility voted by a wide margin for a union. It was seen as a rebuke of the company’s treatment of its employees.
lead_paragraph: It was a union organizing campaign that few expected to have a chance. A handful of employees at Amazon’s massive warehouse on Staten Island, operating without support from national labor organizations, took on one of the most powerful companies in the world.
headline: Amazon Workers on Staten Island Vote to Unionize in Landmark Win for Labor

abstract: Our picks for October, including ‘Colin in Black & White,’ ‘Poltergeist’ and ‘Diana: The Musical’
lead_paragraph: Every month, streaming services in Australia add a new batch of movies and TV shows to its library. Here are our picks for October.
headline: The Best Movies and TV Shows New to Netflix, Amazon and Stan in Australia in October

abstract: Pay, benefits and an aggressive anti-union campaign by the company helped generate votes at a warehouse in Alabama.
lead_paragraph: When Graham Brooks received his ballot in early February, asking whether he wanted to form a union at the Amazon warehouse in Alabama where he works, he did not hesitate. He marked the NO box, and mailed the ballot in.
headline: Why Amazon Workers Sided With the Company Over a Union

abstract: A conversation with the warehouse workers who created an e-commerce giant’s first union against all odds.
lead_paragraph: This week, The Daily is revisiting some of our favorite episodes of the year and checking in on what has happened in the time since they first ran.
headline: How Two Friends Beat Amazon and Built a Union: An Update

abstract: In the food-obsessed port city of Belém, sweet, savory and sometimes addictive dishes are made with fresh ingredients that are tough to come by in Rio de Janeiro, let alone outside Brazil.
lead_paragraph: A foreign visitor walking through Praça Brasil, a leafy square in the Amazonian port city of Belém, might think that the whirring blenders at a dozen nearby food carts were creating the most authentic açaí bowls on earth.
headline: Where the Flavors of the Amazon Rainforest Delight

abstract: Every month, streaming services add a new batch of titles to their libraries. Here are our picks for February.
lead_paragraph: Note: Streaming services occasionally change schedules without giving notice. For more recommendations on what to stream, sign up for our twice-weekly Watching newsletter here.
headline: The Best Movies and TV Shows Coming to Amazon, HBO Max, Hulu and More in February

abstract: With about half the ballots counted late Thursday, votes against unionization had a more than 2-to-1 advantage, according to a tally by The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: With about half the ballots counted late Thursday, votes against unionization had a more than 2-to-1 advantage over those in favor, according to a live broadcast of the counting that was tallied by The New York Times. When the counting paused, there were 1,100 votes against unionization and 463 in support.
headline: Partial tally in Amazon union drive favors ‘No’ votes.

abstract: With several films competing for Golden Globes on Sunday and a number of high-priced movies coming this year, the streaming service has altered its reputation in Hollywood.
lead_paragraph: [Follow live updates from the 2021 Golden Globes and analysis.]
headline: Amazon Moves From Film Industry’s Margins to the Mainstream

abstract: Investors took the strong jobs showing as a reason for the Federal Reserve to move quickly as it starts to raise interest rates this year.
lead_paragraph: Stocks on Wall Street rose on Friday, as an unexpectedly strong jobs report scrambled investors’ expectations for coming interest rate increases and as the latest round of earnings reports offset some fears about declining corporate profits.
headline: Stocks climb as investors weigh a surprising jobs report and Amazon earnings.

abstract: The retail giant said it would stop collecting nonpublic data on rivals and give merchants more ways to reach customers.
lead_paragraph: Amazon tried on Thursday to end a three-year investigation by antitrust regulators in the European Union by offering to make a series of changes to its business practices and give rival merchants an easier way to reach customers on its website.
headline: Amazon Moves to End a Long-Running Antitrust Case in Europe

abstract: The layoffs add to a growing number of cuts in the tech industry this past year.
lead_paragraph: Amazon is laying off hundreds of employees at its studio division as well as its subsidiary Twitch to reduce costs, the latest in a wave of new job cuts hitting the tech industry.
headline: Amazon Cuts Hundreds of Jobs at Studios and Twitch

abstract: The e-commerce giant avoided a fine, but will make a variety of changes regulators believe will help independent merchants who had raised alarms about Amazon’s tactics.
lead_paragraph: Amazon has agreed to a settlement with European Union regulators that will force the company to make significant changes to its business practices but also allows the e-commerce giant to avoid a drawn out legal fight and billions of dollars of potential fines, according to three people with knowledge of the deal.
headline: Amazon Agrees to Change Some Business Practices in E.U. Settlement

abstract: “The Every,” a follow-up to his hit book “The Circle,” will be available in independent bookstores in October. The paperback will arrive just six weeks later, but the hardcover will remain exclusive to independent stores.
lead_paragraph: Dave Eggers has a new novel coming out in the fall called “The Every.” But you won’t be able to buy it in all the usual places — at least not right away.
headline: You Won’t Find the Hardcover of Dave Eggers’s Next Novel on Amazon

abstract: The e-commerce giant planned to build an airport cargo center, hire 1,000 workers and invest hundreds of millions of dollars over 20 years.
lead_paragraph: For the second time, plans by Amazon to substantially expand its presence in the New York area have been abandoned after labor and community groups mobilized in opposition.
headline: Amazon Hub in Newark Is Canceled After Unions and Local Groups Object

abstract: The District of Columbia said in a lawsuit that Amazon had stopped merchants that use its platform from charging lower prices for the same products elsewhere online.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The District of Columbia sued Amazon on Tuesday, accusing it of artificially raising prices for products around the web by abusing its monopoly power, a sign that regulators in the United States are increasingly turning their attention to the company’s dominance across the economy.
headline: D.C. Accuses Amazon of Controlling Online Prices

abstract: Members of the Judiciary Committee accused Amazon of obstructing its inquiry into how the company treats third-party sellers.
lead_paragraph: A House committee asked the Justice Department on Wednesday to investigate Amazon and some of its executives for criminal obstruction of a congressional investigation that included the e-commerce giant.
headline: A House panel calls for a criminal investigation into Amazon.

abstract: The acquisition of iRobot Corp., maker of the robot vacuum, will add to Amazon’s roster of smart home devices, which includes the Alexa virtual assistant and Ring doorbells.
lead_paragraph: Hey, Alexa, tell Roomba to vacuum the bedroom.
headline: Amazon to Buy Maker of the Roomba for $1.7 Billion

abstract: The company hopes a new court show starring the straight-talking judge will help turbocharge its free, ad-supported streaming platform, IMDb TV.
lead_paragraph: CULVER CITY, Calif. — And you thought Amazon’s ambitions in Hollywood were limited to a single streaming service.
headline: Why Amazon Is in Business With Judge Judy

abstract: We’re interested in learning as much as possible about how employers manage their work forces.
lead_paragraph: As Amazon is on the path to becoming the nation’s largest employer, we’ve been reporting on how it manages its vast work force. We’d like to deepen our knowledge of the employment model and practices at Amazon, as well as at other powerful companies.
headline: Do You Work at Amazon or Another Powerful Employer?

abstract: Readers respond to recent issues of the Sunday Book Review.
lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
headline: How Has Amazon Affected America? And Other Letters to the Editor

abstract: Organizers are aiming to form a new union, the Amazon Labor Union.
lead_paragraph: Labor organizers at an Amazon warehouse on Staten Island said they had submitted more than 2,500 worker signatures to the National Labor Relations Board in a petition to hold a union election.
headline: Labor organizers at Amazon’s Staten Island warehouse refile petition for a union election.

abstract: Mark McGurl’s “Everything and Less” examines the impact the tech giant has had on literature itself.
lead_paragraph: EVERYTHING AND LESSThe Novel in the Age of Amazon By Mark McGurl
headline: What Amazon Did to Fiction

abstract: The rainforest holds a fifth of the world’s fresh water, but deforestation, dwindling rain and unrelenting heat are sucking it dry.
lead_paragraph: The planet’s biggest freshwater tank is in trouble.
headline: A Severe Drought Pushes an Imperiled Amazon to the Brink

abstract: The bill would rein in production quotas at warehouses that critics say are excessive and force workers to forgo bathroom breaks.
lead_paragraph: Among the pandemic’s biggest economic winners is Amazon, which nearly doubled its annual profit last year to $21 billion and is on pace to far exceed that total this year.
headline: California Bill Could Alter Amazon Labor Practices

abstract: The e-commerce site said the groups targeted its sites in the United States, Britain, France, Germany, Italy, Spain and Japan.
lead_paragraph: Amazon filed a lawsuit against the leaders of over 10,000 Facebook groups it accused of publishing fake reviews on the e-commerce site, the company announced on Tuesday.
headline: Amazon sues leaders of more than 10,000 Facebook groups it says churn out fake reviews.

abstract: A Times story about the arrival of high-speed internet in a remote Amazon tribe spiraled into its own cautionary tale on the dark side of the web.
lead_paragraph: In April, I hiked more than 50 miles through the Amazon rainforest to visit the remote villages of the Marubo people. The 2,000-member tribe had recently received high-speed internet, and I wanted to understand how it had affected their lives.
headline: No, a Remote Amazon Tribe Did Not Get Addicted to Porn

abstract: Andy Jassy, the chief of Amazon’s cloud computing division, will become chief executive, while Mr. Bezos, the company’s founder, will become executive chairman.
lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — When Jeff Bezos founded an online bookseller named Amazon in 1994, he said the question that he was asked most frequently was “What’s the internet?”
headline: Jeff Bezos to Step Down as Amazon C.E.O.

abstract: Prosecutors said that Seth Aaron Pendley, 28, of Wichita Falls, Texas, had also boasted that he was at the Capitol on Jan. 6 when Trump supporters stormed the building.
lead_paragraph: A Texas man who had boasted that he was at the United States Capitol when swarms of Trump supporters stormed the building on Jan. 6 pleaded guilty on Wednesday to charges of plotting to blow up an Amazon data center in Virginia, prosecutors said.
headline: Man Pleads Guilty to Plotting to Bomb Amazon Data Center

abstract: The Rock & Roll Hall of Fame ceremony will be live-streamed, and “Julia,” “Fargo” and more return. “The Buccaneers” is among the new series out this month.
lead_paragraph: Every month, streaming services add movies and TV shows to its library. Here are our picks for some of November’s most promising new titles. (Note: Streaming services occasionally change schedules without giving notice. For more recommendations on what to stream, sign up for our Watching newsletter here.)
headline: The Best Movies and TV Shows Coming to Amazon, Hulu, Apple TV+ and More in November

abstract: The company also reported that profit more than tripled, to $10.4 billion, topping Wall Street expectations.
lead_paragraph: Amazon reported its highest first-quarter profit on Tuesday as it continued to wring efficiencies out of its retail business and recharge growth in its cloud computing operations.
headline: Amazon Reports $143.3 Billion in Revenue for First Quarter of 2024

abstract: “One in every nine tanks of gas, diesel or jet fuel pumped in California comes from the Amazon,” one researcher said.
lead_paragraph: If you live in California, you may have a closer connection to oil drilling in the Amazon rainforest than you think.
headline: Oil Drilled in the Amazon Rainforest Ends Up in California

abstract: “I felt like the floor was coming off the ground,” said a delivery driver who escaped. The tornado caused the walls of the building to fall inward and the roof to collapse.
lead_paragraph: At least six people were killed at an Amazon warehouse in Illinois after a direct hit from a tornado caused a major portion of the building to collapse on Friday night, officials said.
headline: At least six people died after an Amazon warehouse in Illinois took a direct hit.

abstract: People now spend more at Amazon than Walmart, making it the world’s largest retail seller outside China.
lead_paragraph: People now spend more at Amazon than Walmart, making it the world’s largest retail seller outside China.

We’ll keep this article updated with the best deals as we find them. Keep in mind that many of these deals are exclusive to Prime members.

abstract: After Amazon announced that it was cutting 10,000 jobs due to a $10 billion loss on Alexa at the end of 2022, we worried that the technology heavyweight was having second thoughts about the smart home. But the company’s announcement this week of massive upgrades to Alexa and a slate of new products prompted a...

lead_paragraph: After Amazon announced that it was cutting 10,000 jobs due to a $10 billion loss on Alexa at the end of 2022, we worried that the technology heavyweight was having second thoughts about the smart home. headline: Amazon’s Alexa Is Getting Chattier, and That’s Actually a Good Thing

Using our stringent pricing standards, the Wirecutter Deals team has rounded up the best discounts on our expert-approved Apple picks below. You can also check out the...

It was announced last week that both acquisitions are being reviewed by the Federal Trade Commission, which will draw the process out. If the deals go through, these two companies will join...

It was announced last week that both acquisitions are being reviewed by the Federal Trade Commission, which will draw the process out. If the deals go through, these two companies will join...
headline: How Amazon’s Acquisitions of iRobot and One Medical Could Affect Your Privacy

Whatever you decide to call it, this mega-sale offers plenty of Wirecutter picks at substantial discounts ahead of Black Friday and the holiday shopping season. If you’re on the hunt for deals that will deliver...

lead_paragraph: Cyber Monday is upon us. And of course, there are tons of Cyber Monday deals at Amazon: on Apple gadgets, kitchen gear, Amazon devices, and so much more. Here are the best Cyber Monday Amazon deals we’ve found so far.
headline: The 215+ Best Amazon Cyber Monday Deals 2021

As always, Wirecutter’s expert deal hunters continue to wade through the proverbial trash to help you find the diamonds in the rough. We’ve collected the best of what Amazon has to offer below....

As always, Wirecutter’s expert deal hunters continue to wade through the proverbial trash to help you find the diamonds in the rough. We’ve collected the best of what Amazon has to offer below....
headline: The Best Early Amazon Prime Day Deals of 2023 (So Far)

abstract: The carmaker’s chief executive, Elon Musk, is known for promoting cryptocurrencies on his widely followed Twitter feed.
lead_paragraph: The electric-car maker Tesla is known for bucking convention. That apparently extends to using its own corporate cash to buy Bitcoin.
headline: Tesla says it bought $1.5 billion of Bitcoin, sending the cryptocurrency to a record high.

abstract: Police believe the blaze at a high-voltage power pylon had been deliberately set, amid turmoil over the automaker’s plans to expand its assembly plant near Berlin.
lead_paragraph: Tesla was forced to halt production at its assembly plant outside Berlin early Tuesday after someone set fire to a nearby high-voltage pylon, causing a blaze that cut off electricity to the factory and surrounding region, the police said.
headline: Tesla Halts Production in Germany After Suspected Arson

abstract: A longtime critic of the Tesla chief executive explains why his bets against the car company haven’t paid off.
lead_paragraph: Much has been written about Carson Block, the volatile and sometimes venomous short-seller who runs Muddy Waters Capital. Now, Block is penning some rare words of his own.
headline: The Elan of Elon Musk

abstract: Already two years behind schedule, the Cybertruck has experts wondering how the company will manufacture its unusual stainless steel “exoskeleton.”
lead_paragraph: More than three years after Elon Musk stunned the auto industry with an electric pickup truck that looked more like a stealth fighter than a way to haul two-by-fours and drywall, Tesla said last month that it would begin building the vehicle by the end of 2023.
headline: Tesla’s Pickup Truck Is Coming Soon. Maybe.

abstract: Elon Musk wanted to tap German engineering expertise, but may have gotten more local culture than he had bargained for.
lead_paragraph: GRÜNHEIDE, Germany — The vast pale gray factory with its own exit on the autobahn, surrounded by a pine forest east of Berlin, was supposed to be producing shiny new Teslas by now. Instead it has become a manifestation of what happens when Silicon Valley ambition collides with German procedure.
headline: Tesla’s Factory Near Berlin Runs Into Activists, Red Tape and Lizards

abstract: Federal prosecutors said the pair tried to sell technology to manufacture batteries for electric cars that belonged to the company.
lead_paragraph: A Canadian man who lives in China was arrested Tuesday and held in New York after he and a business partner were accused of trying to sell secret battery manufacturing technology belonging to Tesla.
headline: U.S. Accuses Two Men of Stealing Tesla Trade Secrets

abstract: An innovative E.V. ride-sharing program is bringing low-cost clean transportation to an agricultural town in California’s Central Valley. Others are following suit.
lead_paragraph: Three mornings a week, Herminia Ibarra makes her way to a fleet of sparkling electric vehicles lined up in a dusty alley alongside a former diesel repair shop. Of the five Chevy Bolts, three Tesla Ys, two Volkswagen e-Golfs and a BMW i3, she always tries to snag her favorite: the red Bolt set up with her Bluetooth. In this E.V., she will pick up the two retired farmworkers who are her regular clients and ferry them on two-lane roads to their dialysis appointments 20 miles away.
headline: There’s No Uber or Lyft. There Is a Communal Tesla.

abstract: The carmaker dismissed 500 employees in a unit that was critical to its success and seen as important to the future of electric vehicle sales in the United States.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk has gutted the part of Tesla responsible for building electric vehicle charging stations, sowing uncertainty about the future of the largest and most reliable U.S. charging network.
headline: Tesla Fires Many on Charger Team, Raising Doubts About Expansion

abstract: The electric car company is helping Chinese companies become global players in the emerging industry, posing a competitive threat to traditional rivals.
lead_paragraph: Forty-two years ago, Liu Siong Song built machines to help factories make cheap toys and watches. Then he made them for motorcycle companies.
headline: In China, Tesla Is a Catfish, and Turns Auto Companies Into Sharks

abstract: The electric car company made $1 billion in the second quarter as its revenue roughly doubled from the same period a year earlier.
lead_paragraph: Tesla on Monday reported a big increase in profit for the three months ending in June because it sold more than twice as many cars in the period as it did a year earlier.
headline: Tesla reports a big jump in profit.

abstract: The feature raises fresh questions about whether Tesla is compromising safety as it rushes to add new technologies.
lead_paragraph: Not long after buying a Tesla Model 3 this summer, Vince Patton saw a YouTube clip highlighting a feature that took him by surprise: three video games that can be played on the large touch screen mounted in front of the dashboard — while driving down the road.
headline: A New Tesla Safety Concern: Drivers Can Play Video Games in Moving Cars

abstract: Quotation of the Day for Friday, December 1, 2023.
lead_paragraph: “It looks like something lowered from the lunar module to collect rocks on the moon.”
headline: Quotation of the Day: Pickup or Lunar Lander? Tesla’s Cybertruck Arrives.

abstract: A federal regulator said the electric vehicle maker agreed to disable the feature after an investigation was opened.
lead_paragraph: Tesla has agreed to modify software in its cars to prevent drivers and passengers from playing video games on the dashboard screens while vehicle are in motion, a federal safety regulator said on Thursday.
headline: Tesla agrees to stop letting drivers play video games in moving cars.

abstract: Investors appear to be reconsidering the high share price as other automakers offer more electric vehicles.
lead_paragraph: When the stock of Tesla, the electric carmaker, was added to one of the world’s most important stock indexes in January, some analysts said the company’s shares might no longer jump up and down erratically and could behave more like those of blue-chip companies.
headline: Tesla’s Stock Tumbles Amid Sales Worries and Market Volatility

abstract: Senator Marco Rubio criticized the electric carmaker for opening the outlet in a region where China has been accused of targeting Muslims.
lead_paragraph: Tesla came under fire from political leaders and human rights groups Tuesday after announcing it would open a dealership in the Xinjiang region, where China is accused of detaining hundreds of thousands of Muslims in indoctrination camps.
headline: Tesla opens a dealership in Xinjiang, drawing accusations it’s helping China ‘cover up genocide.’

abstract: The U.S. automaker’s plan to enlarge its operations outside Berlin has divided local residents. Some worry about the environmental costs; others see job prospects.
lead_paragraph: Tesla’s hulking assembly plant outside Berlin, which opened two years ago in a community known for its forests and lakes, still rubs many residents the wrong way. They worry it threatens the quality of their water and air, and has disrupted the peacefulness that drew them to the area.
headline: Let Tesla Expand? Three German Teens Have a Few Thoughts.

abstract: Tesla told the federal regulator that rolling stops were allowed only at intersections when no cars, pedestrians or bicyclists were detected but agreed to disable the feature.
lead_paragraph: Tesla is recalling 54,000 cars equipped with its Full Self-Driving software to disable a feature that in certain conditions lets the vehicles roll slowly through intersections without stopping.
headline: Tesla Recalls Cars With Full Self-Driving to Prevent Rolling Stops

abstract: The data provides the first glimpse into virus cases at Tesla, whose chief executive, Elon Musk, had played down the severity of the pandemic
lead_paragraph: More than 400 workers at a Tesla plant in California tested positive for the coronavirus between May and December, according to public health data released by a transparency website.
headline: Hundreds of Tesla workers tested positive for the virus after Elon Musk reopened a plant, data shows.

abstract: The automaker reported a sharp drop in profits in the third quarter after slashing car prices by around 25 percent in an attempt to compete.
lead_paragraph: Tesla’s profit slumped in the third quarter, disappointing Wall Street expectations, after the carmaker cut prices to maintain its dominance of the market for electric vehicles.
headline: Tesla’s Profits Plunge 44% After Big Price Cuts

abstract: Hertz had said that it would convert more than 20 percent of its rental fleet to Tesla’s cars, a deal that helped propel Tesla’s stock value beyond $1 trillion for the first time.
lead_paragraph: Tesla’s chief executive, Elon Musk, said Monday that the electric vehicle manufacturer had not yet signed a contract with Hertz to sell the car rental agency 100,000 of its vehicles, a deal that was announced last week as Tesla’s stock value pushed past $1 trillion for the first time.
headline: Elon Musk says Tesla has not signed a deal with Hertz yet.

abstract: While its C.E.O., Elon Musk, and the state’s conservative lawmakers share libertarian sensibilities, they differ greatly on climate change and renewable energy.
lead_paragraph: Tesla’s move from Silicon Valley to Texas makes sense in many ways: The company’s chief executive, Elon Musk, and the conservative lawmakers who run the state share a libertarian philosophy, favoring few regulations and low taxes. Texas also has room for a company with grand ambitions to grow.
headline: Are Tesla and Texas a Perfect Match? It’s Questionable.

abstract: Experts say that a new wave of electric vehicle charging stations are coming soon, even after Tesla gutted its charger team.
lead_paragraph: Last week, Tesla laid off most of its electric car charging team, raising doubts about the feasibility of the Biden administration’s ambitious E.V. expansion plans.
headline: With or Without Tesla, More E.V. Chargers Are Coming

abstract: Delays in producing the pickup have allowed rivals like Ford to beat Tesla to market with electric pickups.
lead_paragraph: Tesla will begin producing its much-delayed electric pickup, the Cybertruck, next year along with numerous other new products, Elon Musk, the carmaker’s chief executive, said late Thursday.
headline: Tesla Will Sell Its Long-Awaited Cybertruck Next Year, Elon Musk Says

abstract: The decision by a California jury is the first involving a fatal accident that lawyers representing the victims said was the fault of Tesla’s self-driving technology.
lead_paragraph: A California jury ruled on Tuesday that a crash that killed a Tesla owner and seriously injured two passengers was not the fault of the carmaker’s driver-assistance software.
headline: Tesla Wins Suit That Blamed Its Software for Deadly Crash

abstract: A 2019 crash in Florida highlights how gaps in Tesla’s driver-assistance system and distractions can have tragic consequences.
lead_paragraph: George Brian McGee, a finance executive in Florida, was driving home in a Tesla Model S operating on Autopilot, a system that can steer, brake and accelerate a car on its own, when he dropped his phone during a call and bent down to look for it.
headline: ‘It Happened So Fast’: Inside a Fatal Tesla Autopilot Accident

abstract: “A clock is ticking on one of America’s most famous apps.”
lead_paragraph: On Wednesday, President Biden signed a bill into law that would force the sale of TikTok or ban the app outright. We explain how this came together, when just a few weeks ago it seemed unlikely to happen, and what legal challenges the law will face next. Then we check on Tesla’s very bad year and what’s next for the company after this week’s awful quarterly earnings report. Finally, to boldly support tech where tech has never been supported before: Engineers at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Lab try to fix a chip malfunction from 15 billion miles away.
headline: TikTok on the Clock, Tesla’s Flop Era and How NASA Fixed a ’70s-Era Space Computer

abstract: The leading U.S. electric-vehicle maker also drew buyers eager to take advantage of government incentives that will be harder to get in 2024.
lead_paragraph: Tesla sales jumped during the last three months of 2023 after the carmaker slashed prices and customers rushed to take advantage of tax breaks on electric vehicles — provisions that will be harder to come by in 2024.
headline: Tesla Sales Rebound After Steep Price Cuts

abstract: Firing people. Talking of bankruptcy. Telling workers to be “hard core.” Mr. Musk has repeatedly used those tactics at many of his companies.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk was sleeping at the office. He dismissed employees and executives at will. And he lamented his company was on the verge of bankruptcy.
headline: What Elon Musk Is Doing to Twitter Is What He Did at Tesla and SpaceX

abstract: Five articles from around The Times, narrated just for you.
lead_paragraph: This weekend, listen to a collection of narrated articles from around The New York Times, read aloud by the reporters who wrote them.
headline: The Black Reporter Proved Right By History and a Fatal Tesla Crash: The Week in Narrated Articles

abstract: Incentives and price cuts made Tesla electric cars cheaper than comparable gasoline models. But the company faces growing competition in China, a key market.
lead_paragraph: Tesla sales rose a better-than-expected 10 percent in the second quarter as the company led by Elon Musk benefited from government incentives and price cuts that made its electric cars less expensive than comparable gasoline models.
headline: Tesla Sales Surge as Tax Credits Fuel Demand

abstract: The electric carmaker had to close an important factory in Shanghai because of China’s efforts to stamp out a coronavirus outbreak.
lead_paragraph: Tesla said on Wednesday that it made a $3.3 billion profit in the first three months of the year, up from $438 million a year earlier and the biggest quarterly profit since the company’s creation. But Tesla also said it expected its factories to run below capacity for the rest of 2022.
headline: Tesla’s profits jumped in the first quarter, but challenges loom.

abstract: Elon Musk’s factory in China saved his company and made him ultrarich. Now, it may backfire.
lead_paragraph: When Elon Musk set up Tesla’s factory in China, he made a bet that brought him cheap parts and capable workers — a bet that made him ultrarich and saved his company.
headline: How Tesla Planted the Seeds for Its Own Potential Downfall

abstract: The automaker also reported a big jump in revenue, to $13.8 billion from $8.8 billion a year ago, as sales of the Model Y continue to rise.
lead_paragraph: Tesla made $1.6 billion in the three months ending in September, the second quarter in a row that its profit has exceeded the billion-dollar mark.
headline: Tesla’s quarterly profit nearly quintuples to $1.6 billion as car sales surge.

abstract: “No one was driving the vehicle” when the car crashed and burst into flames, killing two men, a constable said.
lead_paragraph: Two men were killed in Texas after a Tesla they were in crashed on Saturday and caught fire with neither of the men behind the wheel, the authorities said.
headline: 2 Killed in Driverless Tesla Car Crash, Officials Say

abstract: The world’s largest maker of electric cars struggled with production problems in China.
lead_paragraph: Tesla said Wednesday that profit in the second quarter fell nearly one-third from the first quarter as deliveries slowed because of shutdowns and raw materials shortages at the carmaker’s factory in Shanghai.
headline: Tesla Profit Falls in Second Quarter as Supply Chain Problems Hurt

abstract: The company’s directors are asking shareholders to again approve the multibillion-dollar compensation plan and to move the company’s registration to Texas, from Delaware.
lead_paragraph: Facing criticism that it is overly beholden to Elon Musk, Tesla’s board of directors said on Wednesday that it would essentially give him everything he wanted, including the biggest pay package in corporate history.
headline: Tesla Seeks to Revive Musk’s $47 Billion Pay Deal After Judge Says No

abstract: Automakers are struggling to keep up with demand as a global shortage of computer chips is limits how many cars and trucks they can make.
lead_paragraph: Automakers are struggling to keep up with demand as a global shortage of computer chips is limits how many cars and trucks they can make.
headline: Tesla sales are way up, but Ford and others are still grappling with a semiconductor shortage.

abstract: Cryptocurrency prices are soaring after Tesla said that it had purchased $1.5 billion worth of Bitcoin with company funds. The electric carmaker wasn’t the first company to shift corporate cash into cryptocurrencies, but it was one of the biggest. It could make finance chiefs elsewhere consider whether they should follow suit, the DealBook newsletter reports.
lead_paragraph: Cryptocurrency prices are soaring after Tesla said that it had purchased $1.5 billion worth of Bitcoin with company funds. The electric carmaker wasn’t the first company to shift corporate cash into cryptocurrencies, but it was one of the biggest. It could make finance chiefs elsewhere consider whether they should follow suit, the DealBook newsletter reports.
headline: Will other companies follow Tesla’s lead and load up on Bitcoin?

abstract: The National Highway Safety Administration also released an analysis of crashes involving the system that showed at least 29 fatal accidents over five and a half years.
lead_paragraph: The federal government’s main auto safety agency said on Friday that it was investigating Tesla’s recall of its Autopilot driver-assistance system because regulators were concerned that the company had not done enough to ensure that drivers remained attentive while using the technology.
headline: Auto Safety Regulator Investigating Tesla Recall of Autopilot

abstract: Elon Musk, the electric car company’s chief executive, said he would “build products outside of Tesla” unless the board raises his stake to 25 percent.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk, the chief executive of Tesla, stunned investors by demanding that the company’s board give him shares worth more than $80 billion if it wants him to continue developing products based on artificial intelligence.
headline: Musk Demands Bigger Stake in Tesla as Price for A.I. Work

abstract: The governor of Nuevo León said a Tesla official had told him that the company’s plant there would be among its biggest and go up in record time.
lead_paragraph: Tesla’s new factory in the Mexican state of Nuevo León will cost $5 billion, will employ up to 7,000 people and could start churning out cars as early as next year, the state’s governor said on Friday.
headline: Tesla Could Start Making Cars in Mexico Next Year, Governor Says

abstract: The $3.6 billion investment, which also includes a new battery factory, presents a challenge to traditional truck makers that have been slow to sell electric vehicles.
lead_paragraph: Tesla will build a factory in northern Nevada that will manufacture electric semi trucks, the company said Tuesday, putting pressure on traditional truck makers like Daimler and Volvo that are just beginning to sell battery-powered vehicles.
headline: Tesla Will Build Heavy Trucks at a New Factory in Nevada

abstract: We’re all Tesla’s guinea pigs.
lead_paragraph: One of the greatest tricks technology companies ever played was convincing their human guinea pig users that they were a privileged group called beta testers.
headline: Why Tesla’s ‘Beta Testing’ Puts the Public at Risk

abstract: The $7 billion plant will eventually produce half a million S.U.V.s a year, the company said.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Tesla officially began making cars in Europe on Tuesday, opening an assembly plant in a critical market where Elon Musk, the chief executive, plans to build 500,000 electric vehicles a year.
headline: Elon Musk opens Tesla’s first European plant, near Berlin.

abstract: The first-quarter results are likely to fuel worries that competitors will continue grabbing a bigger slice of a market dealing with slowing electric car sales.
lead_paragraph: Tesla reported on Tuesday that it made significantly less money in the first three months of the year because of its tepid car sales, reinforcing concern among investors that the company led by Elon Musk is losing ground in the market for electric vehicles.
headline: Tesla’s Profit Fell 55%, Adding to Concerns About Its Strategy

abstract: In sympathy with striking mechanics, unions representing dockworkers, electricians and others in the country are refusing to do work for the electric carmaker.
lead_paragraph: Electricians and dockworkers across Sweden on Friday joined a widening effort by unions in the country to pressure Tesla to sign a collective bargaining agreement with its mechanics.
headline: Unions in Sweden Expand Blockade Against Tesla

abstract: Nickel is vital to electric car batteries, but extracting it is dirty and destructive. A plant with a turbulent history in New Caledonia is about to become an experiment in doing it better.
lead_paragraph: GORO, New Caledonia — From the reef-fringed coast of New Caledonia, the Coral Sea stretches into the South Pacific. Slender native pines, listing like whimsical Christmas trees, punctuate the shoreline. The landscape, one of the most biodiverse on the planet, is astonishingly beautiful until the crest of a hill where a different vista unfolds: a gouged red earth pierced by belching smokestacks and giant trucks rumbling across the lunar-like terrain.
headline: Can a Tiny Territory in the South Pacific Power Tesla’s Ambitions?

abstract: As the share price plunges, investors wonder whether the company, led by Elon Musk, can withstand intensifying competition.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk appeared to be in a defiant mood Wednesday when he stood before employees at Tesla’s factory near Berlin a week after an arsonist set fire to a high-voltage power pylon and brought production to a standstill.
headline: Tesla’s Troubles Raise Questions About Its Invincibility

abstract: Mr. Musk, the chief executive of Tesla, has turned off many people with polarizing remarks on social media, and it may be affecting the automaker’s sales.
lead_paragraph: Endorsing an antisemitic post on X. Withholding Starlink satellite internet service from Ukraine to prevent a drone attack on Russian forces. Reposting conspiracy theorists who claim that the Biden administration’s immigration policies are part of a plot to increase the number of people who vote Democrat.
headline: Tell Us: Has Elon Musk’s Behavior Affected How You View Tesla?

abstract: The automaker may have undermined safety in designing its Autopilot driver-assistance system to fit its chief executive’s vision, former employees say.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk built his electric car company, Tesla, around the promise that it represented the future of driving — a phrase emblazoned on the automaker’s website.
headline: Inside Tesla as Elon Musk Pushed an Unflinching Vision for Self-Driving Cars

abstract: Defects on certain Tesla models could lead drivers to step on the accelerator pedals for longer than necessary, increasing the risk of collisions, China’s market regulator says.
lead_paragraph: China has ordered Tesla, the world’s dominant maker of electric vehicles, to recall 1.1 million vehicles, citing an issue with the acceleration and braking systems of certain models manufactured in China and abroad.
headline: China Orders Tesla to Recall 1.1 Million Vehicles Over Braking Risks

abstract: A huge sell-off wiped billions of dollars from the electric carmaker’s market capitalization on Tuesday. Analysts see more trouble ahead.
lead_paragraph: With its stock in free fall and competition mounting on all sides, Tesla appears to be losing its most bullish supporters on a daily basis.
headline: Tesla Bulls Brace for a Rough Year Ahead

abstract: The carmakers said they would suspend production at their plants in Germany and Belgium because of supply chain snarls linked to the attacks in the Red Sea.
lead_paragraph: Tesla and Volvo said their assembly lines in Europe would be suspended in coming weeks because of attacks in the Red Sea that have forced cargo ships to take longer routes, disrupting supply chains.
headline: Tesla and Volvo to pause production in Europe after Red Sea attacks.

abstract: Wall Street has grown decidedly pessimistic about Tesla, fearful that Elon Musk, its chief executive, is too focused on Twitter.
headline: Tesla Car Sales Grow Slower Than Expected, Amplifying Concerns

abstract: A California family that lost a 15-year-old boy when a Tesla hit its pickup truck is suing the company, claiming its Autopilot system was partly responsible.
lead_paragraph: Benjamin Maldonado and his teenage son were driving back from a soccer tournament on a California freeway in August 2019 when a truck in front of them slowed. Mr. Maldonado flicked his turn signal and moved right. Within seconds, his Ford Explorer pickup was hit by a Tesla Model 3 that was traveling about 60 miles per hour on Autopilot.
headline: Tesla Says Autopilot Makes Its Cars Safer. Crash Victims Say It Kills.

abstract: If successful, the workers who help develop Tesla’s Autopilot driver-assistance system will be the first group at the company to organize.
lead_paragraph: A group of workers at a Tesla factory in Buffalo began a campaign on Tuesday to form a union, saying they want better pay and benefits. If successful, the effort could establish the first union at the fast-growing auto and energy company, which has fiercely resisted efforts to organize its employees.
headline: Tesla Workers in Buffalo Begin Union Drive

abstract: Two years behind schedule, the electric model has an unusual design that sets it apart from rival pickups, which could limit its sales.
lead_paragraph: Tesla began delivering its much delayed, highly anticipated Cybertruck pickup to customers on Thursday, entering one of the most lucrative but competitive segments of the auto industry.
headline: Pickup or Lunar Lander? Tesla’s Cybertruck Enters a Crowded Market.

abstract: The facility will produce large batteries that will help electric utilities stabilize grids and use more renewable energy.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk, the chief executive of Tesla, announced on Twitter on Sunday that his company would build a factory in Shanghai with the aim to assemble 10,000 giant batteries annually for electric producers and distributors.
headline: Elon Musk Says Tesla Will Build Shanghai Battery Factory

abstract: Shareholders had sued, arguing that Mr. Musk’s compensation — which helped make him the world’s richest person — was excessive.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk, the chief executive of Tesla, suffered a stunning rebuke Tuesday when a Delaware judge voided the pay package that helped make him a billionaire many times over and the world’s wealthiest human being.
headline: Elon Musk’s Tesla Pay Package Is Voided by Judge

abstract: In a letter, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration reminded Tesla that federal law requires automakers to initiate recalls if they find defects that pose a safety risk.
lead_paragraph: The top federal auto safety regulator sent two letters to Tesla this week raising questions about the company’s driver-assistance software systems and instructing the carmaker to provide fuller information.
headline: U.S. regulator questions Tesla on the lack of a recall after an update to Autopilot.

abstract: Shares in Elon Musk’s electric vehicle maker fell sharply after the company delivered lackluster quarterly results and declined to give full-year guidance.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk and Tesla shareholders are at a crossroads.
headline: Tesla Tumbles as Growth Slows

abstract: Elon Musk said Tesla would stop accepting Bitcoin as payment for cars, citing environmental reasons, a move that sent the price of the cryptocurrency plunging.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk has been a big cryptocurrency booster of late, even directing Tesla to buy $1.5 billion in Bitcoin for its corporate treasury earlier this year. On Thursday, he abruptly reversed course, tweeting that Tesla would stop accepting Bitcoin as payment for cars, citing environmental reasons.
headline: Tesla’s U-turn on Bitcoin raises questions of the cryptocurrency’s stability.

abstract: Peter Rawlinson engineered the Tesla Model S. His new Lucid Air sedan is a direct challenge to Tesla’s dominance.
lead_paragraph: It celebrated the production of its first cars less than two months ago. Deliveries have just begun. But for a company with so few vehicles on the road, Lucid Motors is generating a lot of buzz.
headline: He Helped Build Tesla. Now He’s Gunning for It.

abstract: Investors voted overwhelmingly to reinstate the C.E.O.’s multibillion-dollar compensation package, inextricably tying the car maker’s future to the tech billionaire.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk got his way.
headline: What Elon Musk’s Convincing Win Means for Tesla

abstract: The chief executive’s debt load, his divided attention and Twitter’s own challenges could all take a toll on his electric-car company.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk’s deal for Twitter has features that make it risky, including billions of dollars of personal debt. If it goes wrong, it could burn Tesla shareholders and strain Twitter’s financial health.
headline: Why Musk’s Twitter Bid Has Shaken Tesla Investors

abstract: Shares of the company slumped as investors worried about increasing competition.
lead_paragraph: Tesla on Monday cut prices for its cars in China, a sign of intensifying competition in the world’s largest car market that provoked a slump in the company’s shares.
headline: Tesla Cuts Prices in China in Sign of Slowing Demand

abstract: A regulatory filing says officials have asked about software that Elon Musk, the chief executive, has said would allow cars to operate autonomously.
lead_paragraph: Federal officials have asked Tesla for documents related to the company’s self-driving software, the carmaker has disclosed, a potential setback for technology that Elon Musk, the chief executive, has identified as a critical competitive advantage.
headline: Tesla’s Self-Driving Technology Comes Under Justice Dept. Scrutiny

abstract: The electric carmaker has been growing fast in recent years, but Elon Musk, its chief executive, appears to be concerned about a weakening economy.
lead_paragraph: Tesla’s chief executive, Elon Musk, plans to cut 10 percent of the electric carmaker’s salaried work force, he told staff in an email on Friday.
headline: Tesla to Cut 10% of Salaried Staff, Musk Tells Employees

abstract: The electric vehicle maker will ask shareholders to vote again on a multibillion-dollar compensation package that was voided by a judge in January.
lead_paragraph: Nearly three months ago, a Delaware court voided Elon Musk’s multibillion-dollar pay package that Tesla’s board — and most shareholders — had given him in 2018, contending that the process to decide it was “deeply flawed” and that the company didn’t properly disclose it to investors.
headline: Tesla Sets Up a New Showdown Over Elon Musk’s Pay

abstract: “Cool” doesn’t necessarily deliver sustained advantage.
lead_paragraph: If you’re one of those people who bought Bitcoin or another cryptocurrency near its peak last fall, you’ve lost a lot of money. Is it any consolation to know that you would have lost a similar amount if you had bought Tesla stock instead?
headline: Did the Tesla Story Ever Make Sense?

abstract: The board required that Tesla reinstate the employee and that Mr. Musk delete the tweet. It also required that the company amend its confidentiality agreement.
lead_paragraph: The National Labor Relations Board on Thursday upheld a 2019 ruling that Tesla had illegally fired a worker involved in union organizing and that the company’s chief executive, Elon Musk, had illegally threatened workers with the loss of stock options if they unionized.
headline: Tesla employee’s firing and Elon Musk tweet on union were illegal, labor board rules.

abstract: Elon Musk announced the move at the company’s annual shareholder meeting, hosted at a factory Tesla is building near Austin.
lead_paragraph: Tesla will move its headquarters from California to Austin, Texas, where it is building a new factory, its chief executive, Elon Musk, said at the company’s annual shareholder meeting on Thursday.
headline: Tesla Will Move Its Headquarters to Austin, Texas, in Blow to California

abstract: A new report estimates that the company led by Elon Musk accounted for just under half of all battery-powered vehicles sold in the second quarter of the year.
lead_paragraph: Tesla’s once-commanding share of the market for electric vehicles in the United States slipped below 50 percent in the second quarter of the year even as sales of battery-powered cars surged to a record, according to new estimates published Tuesday by a research firm.
headline: Tesla’s Share of U.S. Electric Car Market Falls Below 50%

abstract: Shareholders’ lawyers challenged the board’s contention that Elon Musk’s record-setting compensation was deserved and an effective tool of motivation.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit challenging the pay package that made Elon Musk the world’s wealthiest human, at least for a while, moved a step closer to conclusion on Tuesday as lawyers for aggrieved Tesla shareholders and for the carmaker’s board made last-ditch attempts to sway a judge in their favor.
headline: Judge Hears Arguments in Suit Over Musk’s Tesla Pay

abstract: A jury agreed with Owen Diaz that Tesla had created a hostile environment at its factory in Fremont, Calif.
lead_paragraph: A federal jury in San Francisco has ordered Tesla to pay nearly $137 million to a Black elevator operator who accused the carmaker of ignoring racial abuse he faced while working at the automaker’s factory.
headline: Jury orders Tesla to pay $137 million to a former worker over racist treatment.

abstract: In its first public comment since Mr. Musk sued the artificial intelligence lab, OpenAI claims he tried to commercialize its operations years ago.
lead_paragraph: OpenAI, in its first public comments about Elon Musk’s lawsuit against the influential artificial intelligence research lab, said Mr. Musk had tried to transform the lab from a nonprofit into a for-profit operation before he left the organization in early 2018.
headline: OpenAI Says Elon Musk Tried to Merge It With Tesla

abstract: Some drivers have complained that cars using the company’s Autopilot system have been slowing down suddenly even when there are no hazards ahead.
lead_paragraph: The federal government’s main auto-safety regulator has opened a preliminary investigation into sudden braking by Tesla cars equipped with an advanced driver-assistance system that the company calls Autopilot.
headline: Regulators open an investigation into ‘phantom braking’ by Teslas.

abstract: A federal auto safety agency said the accelerator pedal on the pickup truck, sales of which began in late 2023, could become stuck, increasing the risk of accidents.
lead_paragraph: Tesla has agreed to recall nearly 4,000 of its Cybertruck pickups to fix an accelerator pedal that can get stuck, raising the risk of crashes, a federal safety agency said on Friday.
headline: Tesla Will Recall Cybertruck in Latest Setback

abstract: The Tesla chief executive is taking to his social media company to press shareholders to vote for a critical pay package on June 13.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk, Tesla’s chief executive, offered a personal tour of the electric carmaker’s factory in Austin, Texas, to select shareholders this week.
headline: Elon Musk Lobbies on X for His $46.5 Billion Tesla Pay Package

abstract: The electric carmaker sued the agency to deliver license plates for its cars, the latest escalation as a labor fight enters its second month.
lead_paragraph: Tesla sued Sweden’s Transport Agency on Monday over a strike by postal workers that has blocked delivery of license plates for Tesla cars, the latest escalation of a widening battle between Sweden’s labor unions and the U.S. manufacturer of electric vehicles.
headline: Tesla Sues Swedish Transport Agency in Dispute Over License Plates

abstract: The order, to be fulfilled between now and the end of next year, is a sign of the growing momentum in the shift toward electric cars.
lead_paragraph: Hertz said on Monday that it would convert more than 20 percent of its rental fleet to Tesla’s electric cars by the end of next year, an announcement that helped propel Tesla’s stock value beyond $1 trillion for the first time.
headline: Tesla Value Tops $1 Trillion After Hertz Orders 100,000 Cars

abstract: The vehicles were recalled because the font size on a warning lights panel was too small. Tesla will address the issue with a software update.
lead_paragraph: Tesla is recalling about 2.2 million vehicles because the font on the warning lights panel was too small to comply with safety standards, U.S. regulators said on Friday.
headline: Tesla Recalls About 2.2 Million Electric Vehicles Over Warning Light Font Size

abstract: Federal officials are looking into a series of recent accidents involving Teslas that either were using Autopilot or might have been using it.
lead_paragraph: Federal officials are looking into a series of recent accidents involving Teslas that either were using Autopilot or might have been using it.
headline: Regulators are investigating the role of autonomous driving in 23 Tesla crashes.

abstract: The company recently moved to Texas, which is home to some of the country’s most restrictive abortion laws.
lead_paragraph: Tesla is covering transportation costs for employees to get out-of-state abortions, joining the likes of Citigroup and Yelp as various state regulations have limited access to abortion.
headline: Tesla will cover transportation costs for employee abortions.

abstract: The company has lobbied to reinstate the package awarded to Musk six years ago — now worth about $56 billion — after a Delaware judge voided it.
lead_paragraph: After months of fighting over a pay package promised to Elon Musk six years ago — one that included stock grants now worth about $56 billion — matters are finally coming to a head.
headline: Tesla Shareholders Will Vote on Elon Musk’s Big Payday. What Happens Then?

abstract: The carmaker’s disappointing results point to slowing demand and a “sharp deterioration in growth” that extends beyond Elon Musk’s company.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street has sounded the alarm for weeks that the transition to electric vehicles may be stalling, despite billions in government subsidies and huge investments by auto giants.
headline: What Tesla’s Troubles Signal for the E.V. Revolution

abstract: Sales of the company’s electric cars dropped in the first three months of the year, even as other automakers sold more battery-powered vehicles.
lead_paragraph: Tesla appeared to be losing command of the market it effectively created after it reported a stunning drop in quarterly sales on Tuesday, raising fresh questions about Elon Musk’s leadership of the company.
headline: Tesla’s Sales Drop, a Sign That Its Grip on the E.V. Market Is Slipping

abstract: A local town’s vote against the U.S. automaker’s proposed expansion is nonbinding, but citizens expect it to be honored.
lead_paragraph: Residents in the German community where Tesla has its only assembly plant in Europe overwhelming rejected the company’s plan to expand its facilities, dealing a blow to the U.S. automaker and local supporters.
headline: Let Tesla Expand? Germans Vote No.

abstract: Production problems in China and Elon Musk’s pursuit of Twitter are leading investors to wonder whether the electric car company is worth as much as they thought.
lead_paragraph: Investors are reassessing the premise that justified Tesla’s astronomical stock price and made its founder, Elon Musk, the richest person in the world.
headline: Tesla’s Aura Dims as Its Plunging Stock Highlights the Risks It Faces

abstract: They’re quieter and better for the climate. But snow and water create new technological challenges for designers.
lead_paragraph: STOWE, Vt. — Snowmobiles are part of the winter soundtrack in this part of Vermont, at their worst shattering the stillness of the forest like motorcycles on skis. But the motorized sleds bouncing along a wooded mountain trail in February were silent except for the whoosh of metal runners on snow.
headline: The Tesla Effect: Snowmobiles, Boats and Mowers Go Electric

abstract: Traditional automakers have struggled to sell electric cars. That could change as Ford, Volkswagen and others introduce new models.
lead_paragraph: A few weeks before Christmas, San Tan Ford, a dealership in the Phoenix area, invited car buyers to gawk at the Mustang Mach-E, a highly anticipated electric car that Ford Motor recently started selling.
headline: Tesla Might Finally Have Some Competition. From Ford.

abstract: A filing to the National Labor Relations Board called the dismissals retaliatory. The carmaker denied the allegation, saying they were based on performance.
lead_paragraph: BUFFALO — Barely 24 hours after a group of software workers at a Tesla factory in Buffalo issued a letter declaring their intention to unionize, firings began. And the organizers said it was not a coincidence.
headline: Tesla Fired Buffalo Workers Seeking to Organize, Union Says

abstract: President Biden’s support for autoworkers helped them make big wage gains, and labor organizers are looking to bring about similar gains elsewhere as carmakers transition to electric vehicles.
lead_paragraph: The United Automobile Workers’ big wins with Detroit’s Big Three automakers could also prove to be a significant political victory for President Biden, who openly sided with striking workers to pressure the companies, General Motors, Ford and Stellantis, to produce generous concessions.
headline: Union Victories May Lift Biden, as U.A.W. Targets Tesla and Others

abstract: The chief executive of Tesla testified in a federal civil trial about a 2018 plan to take the automaker private that fizzled out.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk testified on Friday that he was aware that he posted important information on his Twitter account about Tesla, the electric car company he runs. But he denied that his social media posts were responsible for swings in Tesla’s share price.
headline: Elon Musk Says His Social Media Posts Did Not Drive Tesla’s Stock Price

abstract: The company benefited from a jump in sales of electric cars in China and Europe, but its fourth quarter earnings fell short of Wall Street’s expectations.
lead_paragraph: Tesla on Wednesday reported its first full-year profit, a feat 18 years in the making.
headline: Tesla Has First Profitable Year, but Competition Is Growing

abstract: Worry about the carmaker’s sales in the world’s largest car market is one reason the shares have plunged.
lead_paragraph: Tesla sales in China, the world’s largest car market and a crucial element of the company’s fortunes, slumped at the end of 2022 as domestic manufacturers like BYD gained ground with lower-priced electric vehicles, according to data published Thursday.
headline: Tesla Sales in China Slump as Competition Intensifies

abstract: Investors are seeking billions of dollars in damages for their losses after Mr. Musk posted a proposal on Twitter that never materialized.
lead_paragraph: More than four years after he said he had secured the funding to take Tesla off the stock market, Elon Musk will try to defend that statement in a trial that began on Tuesday in a federal court in San Francisco.
headline: Elon Musk Goes to Trial Over His 2018 Plan to Take Tesla Private

abstract: The automaker’s mechanics in Sweden are striking for a collective agreement, and dockworkers say they will support the battle. Tesla is expected to join the talks on Monday.
lead_paragraph: More than a week after Tesla mechanics in Sweden began a strike to compel the U.S. automaker to accept a collective labor agreement, union officials said Tesla representatives would meet with the union on Monday.
headline: Job Action Against Tesla Puts Sweden’s Unions in Spotlight

abstract: The Department of Justice has sought documents related to vehicle range and “personal benefits,” Tesla said.
lead_paragraph: The Department of Justice has expanded its inquiry into Tesla’s business practices to include how far its vehicles can travel on a full charge and “personal benefits” to high-ranking executives or large shareholders, the company said without elaborating.
headline: Federal Investigators Widen Tesla Inquiry, Company Says

abstract: Swedish unions are joining in blockades and targeted strikes against the U.S. automaker over its refusal to sign a collective bargaining agreement with its mechanics.
lead_paragraph: Unions across Sweden said on Tuesday that they would support an effort to pressure Tesla to sign a collective bargaining agreement with its 120 mechanics, joining a campaign to defend a model of organized labor that many Swedes say is essential to the country’s economic success and stability.
headline: Workers in Sweden Will Expand Strike Against Tesla

abstract: German authorities cleared the plant, which was built near Berlin, to open for production. Tesla plans to build 500,000 electric cars a year there.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN — German authorities gave the approval on Friday for Tesla to begin production of electric vehicles and battery cells at its first major assembly plant in Europe, after months of delays and disputes, paving the way for the electric car company to begin production of its Model Y sport utility vehicle.
headline: Tesla Wins Approval to Open European Assembly Plant

abstract: The recall follows a similar move by the company in the United States to upgrade the cars’ Autopilot feature.
lead_paragraph: The Chinese government announced on Friday that Tesla would recall practically all of the cars it has sold in the country to adjust their assisted-driving systems, less than a month after a similar recall in the United States.
headline: Tesla Recalls 1.6 Million Cars in China to Fix Self-Driving Systems

abstract: Tesla, which makes about two-thirds of electric vehicles sold in the United States, has long produced the cars with the best range.
lead_paragraph: Lucid Motors, a start-up automaker, has unseated Tesla, the dominant maker of electric cars, as the producer of the electric vehicle that can travel farthest on a single charge.
headline: Lucid Motors beats Tesla in range, going 520 miles on a charge, the E.P.A. says.

abstract: The decline in deliveries by the electric carmaker in the second quarter was the first drop since the beginning of 2020. The main culprit was factory shutdowns in China.
lead_paragraph: Tesla said Saturday that vehicle deliveries from April through June fell 18 percent from the first quarter of the year, a rare slowdown for the company caused by production problems in China.
headline: Tesla Sales Slow as the Pandemic Hobbles Production

abstract: The latest data on jobs and wages are positive on the surface, but a large group of voters are still downbeat about the state of the economy.
lead_paragraph: The U.S. economy is a paradox. Official figures show that growth is solid, jobs are plentiful and wages are climbing, and yet voters are mostly feeling down and giving President Biden little credit.
headline: The Other Side of Soaring Employment Numbers

abstract: Elon Musk confirmed his car company would build a factory in Mexico and said it was working on more affordable vehicles. But he did not reveal a new model, disappointing some investors.
lead_paragraph: Tesla said on Wednesday that it would build a factory in Mexico to manufacture an electric vehicle that would be significantly more affordable than any of the cars it sold now. But the company disappointed investors who were expecting it to make big announcements about new products and strategies.
headline: Tesla Offers a New ‘Master Plan’ but Few Big Revelations

abstract: Inflation recorded another increase; the Fed will probably follow with a new rate bump. And Wells Fargo is under criminal investigation.
lead_paragraph: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration announced on Thursday that it was ramping up an investigation into Tesla’s Autopilot driver-assistance system, which uses cameras and other sensors to control vehicles with little input from drivers. The agency had been conducting a preliminary evaluation of the system but upgraded to an engineering analysis, looking into whether Autopilot fails to keep drivers’ attention on the road. The new analysis brings more intense scrutiny, covering 830,000 vehicles sold between 2014 and 2021 in the United States and involving all four Tesla models; it’s also a necessary step before a recall can be ordered. Tesla tells drivers to stay alert while using the system, but many experts worry that Autopilot and similar technology can lead drivers to mistakenly believe their vehicles are completely self-driving.
headline: The Week in Business: Trouble for Tesla?

abstract: The sales numbers, which cover the entire world, came a day after General Motors and Ford Motor reported that their U.S. sales were up modestly.
lead_paragraph: Tesla said on Friday that it more than doubled the number of cars it delivered in the first quarter, bouncing back after the pandemic slowed sales in the same period a year ago.
headline: Tesla delivered 185,000 cars in the first quarter, twice as many as a year ago.

abstract: And what would that mean for the climate?
lead_paragraph: Tesla is in a bad spot.
headline: Has Tesla Peaked?

abstract: The pandemic dampened sales for all automakers in the spring and summer, and Tesla’s plant in Fremont, Calif., was idled from late March until the middle of May.
lead_paragraph: After several years of rapid growth, Tesla’s sales in the United States appear to have slowed in 2020, partly as a result of the coronavirus pandemic, according to fresh data on new-car registrations.
headline: Tesla’s U.S. sales slowed in 22 states in 2020, partly because of the pandemic.

abstract: Mr. Musk gave just over five million shares of Tesla to charity in November, making him the second-biggest donor last year, behind only Bill Gates and Melinda French Gates.
lead_paragraph: In an inconspicuous fashion — via a regulatory filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission — Elon Musk, Tesla’s chief executive, disclosed on Monday that he gave nearly $6 billion worth of the company’s shares to charity last year, instantly propelling him into the upper ranks of philanthropic donors.
headline: Elon Musk quietly donated nearly $6 billion last year. Where did it go?

abstract: Elon Musk, the Tesla chief executive, may be able to exploit his rivals’ weaknesses, but the United Automobile Workers union also has the electric carmaker in its sights.
lead_paragraph: The United Automobile Workers strike against the Michigan automakers would seem to be nothing but good news for Tesla, the electric vehicle maker that has upended the industry and stolen customers from Ford Motor, General Motors and Stellantis, which owns Jeep and Ram.
headline: For Tesla and Musk, Auto Strike Carries Benefits and Risks

abstract: A huge run-up in the stock’s value followed a 2018 vote on Elon Musk’s compensation package. But investors have recently become less enamored.
lead_paragraph: The Tesla shareholder vote over Elon Musk’s pay is in some ways a referendum on the performance of the company and its chief executive.
headline: Tesla Share Price Is Its Own Referendum on Musk

abstract: A state agency said the electric carmaker had misled the public in describing its driver-assistance service as autonomous.
lead_paragraph: California’s Department of Motor Vehicles has accused Tesla of falsely advertising its driver-assistance technology in two complaints that could affect the company’s ability to sell cars in the state.
headline: California Regulator Accuses Tesla of Falsely Advertising Autopilot

abstract: The carmaker and energy company settled with a Black man who had worked at its California factory and had won a $3 million judgment against the company.
lead_paragraph: Tesla and a former employee have agreed to settle a closely watched lawsuit that cast a harsh light on the carmaker’s treatment of Black workers.
headline: Tesla Settles Discrimination Suit With Former Factory Worker

abstract: It will be the broadest look yet at Tesla’s assisted-driving technology. The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has the authority to force a recall or require new safety features.
lead_paragraph: The U.S. auto safety regulator said Monday that it had opened a broad investigation of the Autopilot system used in hundreds of thousands of Tesla’s electric cars.
headline: U.S. Will Investigate Tesla’s Autopilot System Over Crashes With Emergency Vehicles

abstract: Analysts expected a decline in sales for the quarter. Still, the dip may raise concerns about flagging demand.
lead_paragraph: Sales of Tesla electric cars slipped from July through September after the company paused production at some factories to upgrade assembly lines.
headline: Tesla’s Sales Slip as It Readies Factories for New Models

abstract: Robyn Denholm, who has led the electric car company’s board for more than five years, has been criticized for not serving as a check on Mr. Musk.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk, the chief executive and public face of Tesla, is constantly making news and broadcasting his opinions on his social media site, X. But the electric car company has another leader — one who maintains a much lower profile.
headline: Tesla’s Chair Under Scrutiny for Oversight of Elon Musk

abstract: The company bought a shuttered General Motors plant in Ohio but struggled to produce its pickup truck.
lead_paragraph: Lordstown Motors, the troubled electric vehicle company that bought a shuttered General Motors factory in Ohio with grand plans to create the Tesla of pickup trucks, filed for bankruptcy protection on Tuesday.
headline: Lordstown Motors, an Electric Truck Maker, Files for Bankruptcy

abstract: The case centered on whether investors lost money because they believed Mr. Musk’s social media posts about taking Tesla private in 2018.
lead_paragraph: A jury decided Friday that Elon Musk was not liable for losses suffered by investors after he posted messages on Twitter saying he had secured the funding to take Tesla private in 2018.
headline: Jury Rules for Elon Musk and Tesla in Investor Lawsuit Over Tweets

abstract: The automaker reduced the price of the Mustang Mach-E by up to $5,900 after Tesla slashed prices of its cars by as much as 20 percent.
lead_paragraph: Ford Motor said on Monday that it was cutting prices on its top-selling battery-powered model, the Mustang Mach-E, and increasing production of the sport utility vehicle. It was the latest sign of intensifying competition in the electric car market.
headline: Ford Follows Tesla in Cutting Electric Vehicle Prices

abstract: Federal regulators are investigating 23 recent accidents in which drivers were, or may have been, using the automatic steering and braking system.
lead_paragraph: Tesla faced numerous questions about its Autopilot technology after a Florida driver was killed in 2016 when the system of sensors and cameras failed to see and brake for a tractor-trailer crossing a road.
headline: Tesla’s Autopilot Technology Faces Fresh Scrutiny

abstract: The action began with a walkout by mechanics in October, but has spread to include blockades by other unions. Tesla has pushed back through the courts.
lead_paragraph: Weeks after mechanics working for Tesla in Sweden walked off their jobs in late October, members of other unions across the country and elsewhere in Scandinavia have joined the strike in sympathy by refusing to provide services to Tesla to pressure the automaker to sign a collective agreement with its Swedish workers.
headline: Tesla Is Fighting With Sweden’s Unions. Here’s What to Know.

abstract: The EQS has a range of 770 kilometers or about 480 miles, according to Mercedes. If that figure is confirmed, the EQS would dethrone the Tesla Model S Long Range Plus as the electric car with the longest range.
lead_paragraph: Mercedes-Benz unveiled an electric counterpart to its top-of-the-line S-Class sedan on Thursday, the latest in a series of moves by German automakers to defend their dominance of the high end of the car market against Tesla.
headline: Mercedes unveils an electric version of its S-Class that goes farther than a Tesla.

abstract: Under pressure from federal regulators, the company has agreed to recall two million cars to update its driver-assistance system. The cars will be updated over cellular networks.
lead_paragraph: Drivers of Tesla vehicles will automatically receive the software updates the company is issuing to address concerns from federal auto safety regulators about its driver-assistance system, Autopilot.
headline: What Car Owners Should Know About the Tesla Autopilot Recall

abstract: The sales so far were considerably short of the $20 billion worth he promised over the weekend that he would sell.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk, the chief executive of Tesla, disclosed on Wednesday that he had sold about $5 billion worth of Tesla shares, in part to cover his tax obligations after exercising options on a large tranche of stock.
headline: Elon Musk sells $5 billion in Tesla shares, partly to cover taxes on stock options.

abstract: The 2018 tweet, in which Mr. Musk claimed he had secured funding to take Tesla private, initially sent the automaker’s shares soaring. But they sank when it became clear that no such deal had been reached.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk’s Twitter post about taking Tesla private is still dogging him, more than three years later.
headline: JPMorgan says Tesla owes it $162 million because of an Elon Musk tweet.

abstract: The yawning disparity between the performance of the electric car company and established automakers last year reflects the technological change roiling the industry.
lead_paragraph: For much of last year, established automakers like General Motors and Ford Motor operated in a different reality from Tesla, the electric car company.
headline: Why Tesla Soared as Other Automakers Struggled to Make Cars

abstract: The recalls, which Tesla initiated on Dec. 21, affect about 350,000 Model 3s and 120,000 Model S cars.
lead_paragraph: Tesla has told federal regulators that it plans to recall more than 475,000 cars for two separate defects that could affect safety.
headline: Tesla Recalls Some Sedans Over Two Safety Defects

abstract: The request by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is part of an investigation into Tesla cars crashing into parked emergency vehicles.
lead_paragraph: The main federal auto safety agency has ordered Tesla to hand over a trove of data on its Autopilot driver-assistance system as part of an investigation into Tesla cars crashing into fire trucks or other emergency vehicles parked on roads and highways.
headline: Tesla is ordered to turn over Autopilot data to a federal safety agency.

abstract: The vote was seen as a referendum on his management of the electric car maker and on the limits of executive pay.
lead_paragraph: Tesla shareholders have reaffirmed a pay award of more than $45 billion for Elon Musk, the chief executive, after it was thrown out in a legal challenge.
headline: Tesla Shareholders Approve Big Stock Package for Musk

abstract: The maker of electric cars faces sharp competition, plummeting shares and production woes while its chief executive is preoccupied with Twitter.
lead_paragraph: Production headaches on three continents. Intensifying competition. A plunging share price. And a distracted chief executive seemingly bent on alienating some of the company’s most loyal customers.
